translated: If one compares the previous accumulation of merit to this accumulation of merit, it is not even one hundredth of it, not even one thousandth of it, not even one hundred thousandth of it, not even a count, not even a calculation, not even a reckoning, not even a comparison, not even up to an upaniṣad fraction of it.

translated: Although the previous accumulation of merit was vast, it is not even a fraction of this, because the Tathāgatas have cultivated immeasurable superior precepts, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation for three great incalculably long eons,
